title: 27 Beauty Launches Our Editors Are Loving This June
description: Summer is officially within our reach. You know what that means: beach days, European vacations, outdoor dining, sundresses, the works. To fully embrace the warm weather, there are some necessary changes in our beauty routines that need to be made. It's time to head to the store to pick up a new bottle of SPF (because it expires) , swap your rich moisturizer for a lightweight formula that won't break you out, and rotate in some berry makeup shades. It may also be time to break out the self tanner, find the perfect bright red nail polish shade to live out your Italian summer dream, grab a freckle pen to fake the cute spots across your notes without the sun damage – you get the idea. Luckily, there are plenty of new beauty products launching this June from your favorite to explore and our editors have been putting them to the test so that you know what's worth hitting that "add to cart" button on. We've fallen in love with new formulas across all categories - hair, makeup, skin, body, nails, and fragrance - and all price points, from luxurious moisturizers to splurge on to an $8 mascara that we can't put down. To get the scoop on the best new beauty launches for June, keep reading.
author: Jessica Harrington
excerpt: PS editors reveal the best hair, makeup, skin-care, nail, and fragrance launches for June 2025. Shop the summer product picks here.

Trudon's limited-edition Summer Haze Candle was created by perfumer Alexandra Carlin and is described as a 'gourmand floral berry.' It has notes of Lily of the Valley, rose, musk, and Tonka bean for a juicy but fresh scent. The bright pink vessel also adds a beautiful pop of color to my room for summer." — Jessica Harrington, senior beauty editorDesign Elements: Getty; Sephora; Ulta; Revolve; Crown Affair; Kylie Cosmetics Photo Illustration: Keila GonzalezJessica Harrington (she/her) is the senior editor of PS Beauty, where she oversees coverage around makeup, skin care, hair, tattoos, and more. With more than nine years of industry experience, she has interviewed countless celebrities, reported on hundreds of beauty trends, and swatched more lipsticks than she can count. Prior to PS, Jessica worked for publications such as Makeup.com, Skincare.com, and The Zoe Report.
